sen.j: 双林寺（そうりんじ）は、京都市山科区にある天台宗の寺院。
sen.e: The Sorin-ji Temple is a temple of the Tendai sect in Yamashina Ward, Kyoto City.
The Sorin-ji Temple is a temple of the Tendai sect in Yamashina Ward, Kyoto City.
The Sorin-ji Temple is a temple of the Tendai sect in Yamashina Ward, Kyoto City.
It is commonly called Yamashina Shoten.
It is commonly called Yamashina Shoten.
It is commonly called Yamashina Shoten.
It sango (literally, "mountain name"), which is the title prefixed to the name of a Buddhist temple, is Gohozan.
It sango (literally, "mountain name"), which is the title prefixed to the name of a Buddhist temple, is Gohozan.
It sango (literally, "mountain name"), which is the title prefixed to the name of a Buddhist temple, is Gohozan.
Its honzon (principal image of Buddha) is Kangiten (Nandikesvara, Ganesh in the Buddhist pantheon).
Its honzon (principal image of Buddha) is Kangiten (Nandikesvara, Ganesh in the Buddhist pantheon).
Its honzon (principal image of Buddha) is Kangiten (Nandikesvara, Ganesh in the Buddhist pantheon).
Its honzon (principal image of Buddha) is Kangiten (Nandikesvara, Ganesh in the Buddhist pantheon).
It is a tatchu (sub-temple on the site of the main temple) of Bishamon-do Monzeki-temple (temple formerly led by founder of the sect, temple in which resided a member of nobility or imperial family).
It is a tatchu (sub-temple on the site of the main temple) of Bishamon-do Monzeki-temple (temple formerly led by founder of the sect, temple in which resided a member of nobility or Imperial Family).

sen.j: 1665年天台宗の僧である公海 (僧)により創建された。
sen.e: In 1655 it was founded by Kokai, a priest of the Tendai sect.

sen.j: 不動堂‐本尊は延暦寺より勧請されたもの。
sen.e: Fudo-do Hall: the honzon was appealed to the Enryaku-ji Temple.

sen.j: 阿弥陀堂‐本尊は西明寺 (甲良町)より勧請されたもの。
sen.e: Amida-do Hall (temple hall having an enshrined image of Amitabha): the honzon was appealed to the Saimyo-ji Temple (Kora Town).

sen.j: 西日本旅客鉄道・京阪電気鉄道線山科駅から徒歩約20分。
sen.e: About twenty minutes walk from the Yamashina station operated by West Japan Railway Company (JR West) and the other Yamashina station operated by Keihan Electric Railways.
